optimal_care.description: Clean food spills containing acids immediately after the range is cool
Never use abrasive cleaners or steel wool on stainless steel surfaces
Keep burner caps properly positioned and level for optimal performance
Always use nonabrasive plastic scrubbing pad for cleaning grates and caps when cool
Never reassemble caps on burners while wet
Keep oven vent ducts unobstructed at all times
Apply light coating of vegetable oil to rack guides if they become difficult to slide

support.description: Contact information available in Quick Start Guide
Contact qualified technician for persistent gas supply issues
Installation and repairs must be performed by qualified or licensed contractor

safety.description: Never operate top surface cooking section unattended
Install anti-tip bracket to floor or wall according to installation instructions
Do not store gasoline or flammable vapors near appliance
Use UL or CSA approved gas detector for leak detection
If gas smell detected, do not light appliance and call gas supplier from neighbor's phone

cleaning.description: Use soap, water, and soft cloth or sponge for general cleaning
Use Affresh® Kitchen and Appliance Cleaner for exterior surfaces
Use Affresh® Stainless Steel Cleaner for stainless steel surfaces
Use mild detergent for storage drawer cleaning
For self-cleaning models, remove all racks and accessories before starting cycle

maintenance.description: Check gas connections and burner operation monthly
Check and adjust flame height every 3-6 months
Clean after each use to prevent buildup
Run self-cleaning cycle (if equipped) every 6 months or as needed
